document: Steven Paul Jobs, known as Steve Jobs, was an influential American business magnate, inventor, and investor. He was the co-founder, chairman, and CEO of Apple, as well as the founder, chairman, and CEO of NeXT. Jobs also played a significant role in the success of Pixar, where he served as the chairman and majority shareholder. His impact extended beyond these organizations, as he became a member of The Walt Disney Company's board of directors after Disney acquired Pixar. Jobs was a pioneer of the personal computer revolution in the 1970s and 1980s, alongside his colleague and Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak. Born to a Syrian father and German-American mother in San Francisco, Jobs was adopted shortly after his birth. Although his time at Reed College was fleeting, his contributions to the technology industry and his innovative spirit continue to shape the world today.
noref_document: Steve Jobs, the renowned co-founder of Apple Inc., was a visionary leader and technology pioneer. With his unmistakable style and relentless pursuit of perfection, Jobs revolutionized multiple industries, leaving an indelible mark on the world. Known for his passion for design and user-centric approach, he spearheaded the creation of groundbreaking products like the Macintosh computer, the iPod, iPhone, and iPad. Jobs' ability to seamlessly integrate hardware, software, and services set new standards and transformed Apple into one of the most influential companies globally. His innovative ideas and unwavering commitment to excellence continue to inspire generations of entrepreneurs and shape the future of technology.
summary:
Steven Paul Jobs (born Abdul Lateef Jandali; February 24, 1955 – October 5, 2011) was an American business magnate, inventor, and investor. He was the co-founder, chairman, and CEO of Apple; the chairman and majority shareholder of Pixar; a member of The Walt Disney Company's board of directors following its acquisition of Pixar; and the founder, chairman, and CEO of NeXT. He was a pioneer of the personal computer revolution of the 1970s and 1980s, along with his early business partner and fellow Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak.
Jobs was born in San Francisco to a Syrian father and German-American mother. He was adopted shortly after his birth. Jobs attended Reed College in 1972 before withdrawing that same year.

document: Whitney Houston, known as "the Voice," was an influential American singer and actress. With over 220 million records sold worldwide, she remains one of the best-selling music artists in history. In 2023, Rolling Stone recognized her as the second-greatest singer of all time. Houston's impactful singing style and exceptional vocal abilities influenced numerous artists in the popular music industry. Renowned for her commanding and soulful vocals, she skillfully incorporated gospel singing techniques into her pop music. With an impressive 11 number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100, Houston holds the record for the only artist to achieve seven consecutive chart-topping singles.
noref_document: Whitney Houston, widely regarded as one of the greatest vocalists of all time, was an iconic singer, actress, and producer. Born in 1963, Houston began her music career in the 1980s and quickly rose to prominence with her powerful and soulful voice. She achieved extraordinary success, with numerous chart-topping hits and record-breaking album sales. Houston's ability to effortlessly transition between various music genres, including pop, R&B, and gospel, showcased her versatility and made her an influential figure in the music industry. Not only did she dominate the airwaves, but Houston also made her mark on the silver screen with her performances in films like "The Bodyguard" and "Waiting to Exhale." Despite her remarkable achievements, Houston's personal life faced significant challenges, leading to tabloid scrutiny and occasional struggles with addiction. Nevertheless, her enduring legacy as an exceptional talent and her impact on the music industry continue to inspire generations of aspiring musicians.
summary: Whitney Elizabeth Houston (August 9, 1963 – February 11, 2012) was an American singer and actress. Nicknamed "the Voice", she is one of the best-selling music artists of all time, with over 220 million records sold worldwide. In 2023, Rolling Stone named her the second-greatest singer of all time. Houston influenced many singers in popular music, and was known for her powerful, soulful vocals, vocal improvisation skills, and use of gospel singing techniques in pop music. She had 11 number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100 and is the only artist to have seven consecutive number-one singles on the chart.

document: David Bowie, born David Robert Jones, was an English singer, songwriter, musician, and actor who revolutionized the music industry. Throughout his career, he constantly reinvented himself, pushing the boundaries of sound and style. Bowie's innovative work during the 1970s left a lasting impact on popular music. He was not only acclaimed by critics and musicians but also regarded as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century. Bowie's creativity extended beyond his music, as he incorporated visual presentation and staged performances into his art. From an early age, Bowie's passion for music became apparent, shaping his extraordinary journey in the world of entertainment.
noref_document: David Bowie, a renowned musician, actor, and cultural icon, left an indelible impact on the world of music and art. Born as David Robert Jones in 1947, Bowie rose to fame in the 1970s with his innovative and eclectic musical style, captivating audiences with his chameleon-like persona and genre-defying music. Throughout his career, he successfully reinvented himself with a series of alter egos, such as Ziggy Stardust and the Thin White Duke, pushing the boundaries of artistic expression. Bowie's music was characterized by its experimentation, blending genres like rock, pop, soul, and electronic music. Bowie's enduring legacy continues to inspire and captivate audiences, cementing his status as one of the greatest innovators in popular culture.
summary:
David Robert Jones (8 January 1947 – 10 January 2016), known professionally as David Bowie ( BOH-ee), was an English singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. A leading figure in the music industry, he is regarded as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century. Bowie was acclaimed by critics and musicians, particularly for his innovative work during the 1970s. His career was marked by reinvention and visual presentation, and his music and stagecraft had a significant impact on popular music.
Bowie developed an interest in music from an early age.

document: Prince Rogers Nelson, better known as Prince, was a tremendously talented American artist who left an indelible mark on the music industry. With his flamboyant and androgynous persona, he captured the attention of audiences worldwide. Not only was he an incredible singer with a wide vocal range, including a distinctive falsetto and powerful screams, but he was also a skilled multi-instrumentalist. Prince often played all or most of the instruments on his own recordings, showcasing his versatility and musical genius. His music transcended genre boundaries, incorporating elements of funk, R&B, rock, new wave, soul, synth-pop, pop, jazz, blues, and hip hop. Moreover, Prince was a pioneer, producing his albums himself and famously giving birth to the Minneapolis sound. His contributions to the music world, coupled with his numerous awards and accolades, make him undeniably one of the greatest musicians of his generation.
noref_document: Prince, the legendary musician, was one of the greatest musical icons of the 20th century. With a distinct style that blended funk, rock, pop, and R&B, Prince captivated audiences with his mesmerizing performances and groundbreaking music. Known for his flamboyant personality and gender-bending fashion choices, he pushed the boundaries of artistry and sexuality in the music industry. With hit songs like "Purple Rain," "Kiss," and "When Doves Cry," Prince established himself as an unparalleled artist and his music continues to influence generations of musicians to this day. Despite his untimely death in 2016, Prince's legacy lives on, reminding us of his extraordinary talent and the impact he made on the world of music.
summary: Prince Rogers Nelson (June 7, 1958 – April 21, 2016) was an American singer, songwriter, musician, record producer, and actor. The recipient of numerous awards and nominations, he is widely regarded as one of the greatest musicians of his generation. He was known for his flamboyant, androgynous persona; his wide vocal range, which included a far-reaching falsetto and high-pitched screams; and his skill as a multi-instrumentalist, often preferring to play all or most of the instruments on his recordings.  His music incorporated a wide variety of styles, including funk,  R&B,  rock,  new wave,  soul,  synth-pop,  pop,  jazz, blues, and hip hop. Prince produced his albums himself, pioneering the Minneapolis sound.

document: Alan Sidney Patrick Rickman, the renowned English actor and director, possessed a distinctive deep voice that captivated audiences worldwide. His talent was honed at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London before joining the prestigious Royal Shakespeare Company. Rickman mesmerized audiences with his performances in both modern and classical theatre productions. Notably, he portrayed the Vicomte de Valmont in the production of Les Liaisons Dangereuses, receiving acclaim as the play transitioned from the RSC stage to the West End and eventually Broadway. In 1988, Rickman made his foray into film as the German terrorist leader Hans Gruber in Die Hard. Shortly after, he delivered a compelling portrayal of the Sheriff of Nottingham in Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, winning the BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role.
noref_document: Alan Rickman was an iconic British actor, renowned for his remarkable stage presence and captivating film performances. Born in 1946 in London, Rickman began his career in theater and quickly made a name for himself with his commanding voice and ability to portray complex characters. He gained widespread recognition for his role as the villainous Hans Gruber in the action-packed film "Die Hard" (1988), which propelled him into international stardom. Throughout his career, Rickman portrayed a wide range of characters, from the enigmatic Severus Snape in the "Harry Potter" film series to the brooding Colonel Brandon in "Sense and Sensibility" (1995). With his distinctive voice, nuanced acting style, and notable filmography, Alan Rickman left an indelible mark on the world of entertainment and his legacy continues to inspire aspiring actors and fans alike.
summary:
Alan Sidney Patrick Rickman (21 February 1946 – 14 January 2016) was an English actor and director. Known for his distinctive deep, languid voice, he trained at RADA (the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art) in London and became a member of the Royal Shakespeare Company (RSC), performing in modern and classical theatre productions. He played the Vicomte de Valmont in the RSC stage production of Les Liaisons Dangereuses in 1985, and after the production transferred to the West End in 1986 and Broadway in 1987, he was nominated for a Tony Award.
Rickman's first film role came when he was cast as the German terrorist leader Hans Gruber in Die Hard (1988). He appeared as the Sheriff of Nottingham in Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves (1991), for which he won the BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role.

document: Robin Williams, the legendary American actor and comedian, captivated audiences with his unparalleled improvisational skills and an incredible range of characters. He effortlessly created these characters on the spot, showcasing his comedic genius in both dramatic and comedic films. Recognized as one of the greatest comedians of all time, Williams received numerous accolades throughout his career. His talent earned him an Academy Award, two Primetime Emmy Awards, six Golden Globe Awards, two Screen Actors Guild Awards, and five Grammy Awards. Williams started his journey by performing stand-up comedy in San Francisco and Los Angeles during the mid-1970s. He also released several comedy albums, including "Reality ... What a Concept" in 1980.
noref_document: Robin Williams, the beloved American comedian and actor, left an indelible mark on the entertainment industry with his exceptional talent and magnetic personality. Williams effortlessly crafted unforgettable characters, from the zany alien Mork in "Mork & Mindy" to the iconic Mrs. Doubtfire. His improvisational skills and boundless energy brought laughter and joy to millions around the world. Beyond his comedic genius, Williams showcased his dramatic prowess in films such as "Good Will Hunting," earning him an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. Despite his immense success, Williams battled with personal challenges, including mental health issues. His untimely death in 2014 was a devastating loss, leaving a void in the hearts of his fans and fellow artists alike. Nevertheless, Robin Williams' enduring legacy reminds us of the power of laughter, the importance of authentic connection, and the profound impact that a single individual can make on the lives of many.
summary:
Robin McLaurin Williams (July 21, 1951 – August 11, 2014) was an American actor and comedian. Known for his improvisational skills and the wide variety of characters he created on the spur of the moment and portrayed on film, in dramas and comedies alike, he is regarded as one of the greatest comedians of all time. He received numerous accolades including an Academy Award, two Primetime Emmy Awards, six Golden Globe Awards, two Screen Actors Guild Awards, and five Grammy Awards.
Williams began performing stand-up comedy in San Francisco and Los Angeles during the mid-1970s, and released several comedy albums including Reality ... What a Concept in 1980.

document: Carrie Fisher, a renowned American actress and writer, left an indelible mark on the entertainment industry. Though she had a versatile career, Fisher is best remembered for her iconic portrayal of Princess Leia in the original Star Wars films. Her fiery personality and fearless demeanor resonated with audiences worldwide, making her a beloved figure in the Star Wars universe. Despite her tragic passing in 2016, Fisher's legacy endured as she posthumously appeared in subsequent Star Wars films. Beyond her Star Wars success, Fisher showcased her talent in various other movies like Shampoo, The Blues Brothers, When Harry Met Sally..., and The Women. Her remarkable performances earned her nominations for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress. Carrie Fisher will always be remembered as a trailblazer and an inspiration to many in the entertainment industry.
noref_document: Carrie Fisher, the iconic actress, author, and advocate, is best known for her groundbreaking role as Princess Leia in the original Star Wars trilogy. Her portrayal of Leia Organa captivated audiences with her strength, intelligence, and determination, making her an empowering figure for many young women. Beyond her acting career, Fisher was also a talented writer, penning several bestselling novels and memoirs that showcased her wit and vulnerability. Additionally, she openly discussed her struggles with mental health and addiction, becoming a prominent advocate for reducing the stigma surrounding these issues. Fisher's impact and legacy extend far beyond the galaxy far, far away, as she continues to inspire and empower countless individuals with her honesty, humor, and resilience.
summary: Carrie Frances Fisher (October 21, 1956 – December 27, 2016) was an American actress and writer. She was best known for playing Princess Leia in the original Star Wars films (1977–1983). She reprised the role in Star Wars: The Force Awakens (2015), The Last Jedi (2017) — a posthumous release that was dedicated to her — and appeared in The Rise of Skywalker (2019), through the use of unreleased footage from The Force Awakens.Fisher's other film credits include Shampoo (1975), The Blues Brothers (1980), Hannah and Her Sisters (1986), The 'Burbs (1989), When Harry Met Sally... (1989), Soapdish (1991), and The Women (2008). She was nominated twice for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series for her performances in the NBC sitcom 30 Rock (2007) and the Channel 4 series Catastrophe (2017).

document: Chester Charles Bennington, the talented American singer, made a significant impact as the lead vocalist of rock band Linkin Park. His powerful vocals and emotional lyrics captivated audiences worldwide, especially following the release of the band's debut album, Hybrid Theory, in 2000. This album achieved remarkable success, earning a Diamond certification and becoming one of the bestselling debut albums of the decade. Bennington's undeniable talent and contribution to Linkin Park continued throughout their discography, with each subsequent studio album charting in the top three spots of the Billboard 200. In addition to his work with Linkin Park, Bennington formed the band Dead by Sunrise in 2005, showcasing his versatility and passion for music.
noref_document: Chester Bennington, the legendary American singer, songwriter, and musician, was widely recognized as the lead vocalist for the rock band Linkin Park. Bennington's powerful and emotive voice served as the driving force behind the band's chart-topping hits and their unique blend of alternative rock, nu-metal, and electronic music. Known for his raw and intense lyrics, he brought a sense of vulnerability and authenticity to his performances, captivating audiences around the world. With his distinctive vocal range and ability to express deep emotional pain, Bennington became an icon for a generation of music lovers, leaving an indelible mark on the music industry before his untimely passing in 2017.
summary:
Chester Charles Bennington (March 20, 1976 – July 20, 2017) was an American singer who served as the lead vocalist of rock band Linkin Park. He was also a lead vocalist of Grey Daze, Dead by Sunrise and Stone Temple Pilots at various points.
Bennington first gained prominence as a vocalist following the release of Linkin Park's debut album, Hybrid Theory (2000), which was a worldwide commercial success. The album was certified Diamond by the Recording Industry Association of America in 2005, making it the bestselling debut album of the decade, as well as one of the few albums ever to achieve that many sales. He continued to serve as the band's lead vocalist for their next six studio albums, from Meteora (2003) to One More Light (2017), with each charting within the top three spots of the Billboard 200.Bennington formed his own band, Dead by Sunrise, as a side project in 2005.

document: Chris Cornell was an American singer, songwriter, and musician who made a significant impact on the rock music scene. As the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and primary lyricist for the renowned rock bands Soundgarden and Audioslave, Cornell showcased his immense talent, captivating audiences with his powerful vocal belting technique and his nearly four-octave vocal range. Apart from his work with these bands, Cornell had a successful solo career and contributed to various movie soundtracks. He founded Temple of the Dog as a tribute band to his late friend Andrew Wood, further showcasing his musical versatility and his ability to connect with fans on a deeper level. Cornell's contributions to the grunge movement of the 1990s solidified his status as one of the greatest rock singers of all time.
noref_document: Chris Cornell was an iconic American singer, songwriter, and musician. He was best known as the lead vocalist for the bands Soundgarden and Audioslave, and his powerful voice and unique songwriting style made him one of the most influential figures in the grunge and alternative rock movements of the 1990s. With a four-octave vocal range, Cornell captivated audiences with his soulful and often introspective lyrics. Throughout his career, he released several successful solo albums and collaborated with numerous artists, further cementing his reputation as a versatile and talented musician. Unfortunately, Cornell tragically passed away in 2017, but his impact on the music world continues to be celebrated and cherished.
summary: Christopher John Cornell (né Boyle; July 20, 1964 – May 18, 2017) was an American singer, songwriter and musician best known as the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and primary lyricist for the rock bands Soundgarden and Audioslave. He also had a solo career and contributed to numerous movie soundtracks. Cornell was the founder and frontman of Temple of the Dog, a one-off tribute band dedicated to his late friend Andrew Wood. Several music journalists, fan polls and fellow musicians have regarded Cornell as one of the greatest rock singers of all time.Cornell is considered one of the key figures of the 1990s grunge movement. He is well known for his extensive catalog as a songwriter, his nearly four-octave vocal range, and his powerful vocal belting technique.

document: Avicii, the professional name of Tim Bergling, was more than just a DJ, remixer, and music producer—he was a trailblazer in the electronic music scene. The Swedish artist first gained attention at a young age by sharing his remixes on electronic music forums. The recognition led to a record deal, launching his career to new heights. Avicii's breakthrough single "Levels" propelled him to stardom in 2011, and he continued to push boundaries with his debut studio album, True. With its blend of electronic music and diverse genres, the album garnered positive reviews and achieved commercial success worldwide. One of its standout tracks, "Wake Me Up," secured the number one spot in numerous European music markets and reached number four in the United States. Avicii's contributions to the music industry will be remembered and celebrated for years to come.
noref_document: Avicii was a Swedish musician, DJ, and record producer known for his innovative and influential contributions to electronic dance music. His unique sound blended catchy melodies, infectious beats, and emotive lyrics, creating a distinct fusion of pop and EDM. With chart-topping hits like "Wake Me Up" and "Levels," Avicii brought EDM into the mainstream, captivating audiences worldwide. However, beyond his commercial success, Avicii also struggled with mental health issues and the pressures of fame. His untimely death in 2018 served as a tragic reminder of the toll that the music industry can take on artists. Nonetheless, Avicii's impact on the world of electronic music remains profound, and his legacy continues to inspire aspiring musicians and fans alike to push boundaries and express themselves through the power of music.
summary: Tim Bergling (Swedish: [ˈtɪmː ˈbæ̂rjlɪŋ] ; 8 September 1989 – 20 April 2018), known professionally as Avicii ( ə-VEE-chee, Swedish: [aˈvɪ̌tːɕɪ]), was a Swedish DJ, remixer, and music producer. At age 16, Bergling began posting his remixes on electronic music forums, which led to his first record deal. He rose to prominence in 2011 with his single "Levels". His debut studio album, True (2013), blended electronic music with elements of multiple genres and received generally positive reviews. It peaked in the top 10 in more than 15 countries and topped international charts; the lead single, "Wake Me Up", topped most music markets in Europe and reached number four in the United States.

document: Pebble, the popular smartwatch developed by Pebble Technology Corporation, made history when it raised an impressive $10.3 million through a Kickstarter campaign. This made it the most funded project on Kickstarter at the time. Following the successful funding, Pebble started shipping their watches to Kickstarter backers in January 2013. Compatible with both Android and iOS devices, Pebble watches allowed users to conveniently receive notifications and messages. To cater to various needs, an online app store offered a wide range of Pebble-compatible apps developed by ESPN, Uber, Runkeeper, GoPro, and many others. Despite being discontinued, Pebble made a notable impact in the world of wearable technology.
noref_document: Pebble is a name that has become synonymous with smartwatches. Launched in 2013, Pebble quickly gained popularity for its innovative approach to wearable technology. The company's watches boasted an electronic paper display, ensuring a long-lasting battery life of up to one week. Compatible with both Android and iOS devices, Pebble watches offered a range of features, including activity tracking, notifications, and music control. Additionally, the watches allowed users to customize their appearance through interchangeable watchfaces and bands. With the support of a dedicated community of developers, Pebble's ecosystem grew rapidly, offering a wide array of third-party apps and watchfaces. Despite Pebble's eventual demise in 2016, the brand left a lasting impact on the smartwatch industry, paving the way for future advancements in wearable technology.
summary: Pebble is a discontinued smartwatch developed by Pebble Technology Corporation. Funding was conducted through a Kickstarter campaign running from April 11, 2012, to May 18, 2012, which raised $10.3 million; it was the most funded project in Kickstarter history, at the time. Pebble began shipping watches to Kickstarter backers in January 2013. Pebble watches can be connected to Android and iOS devices to show notifications and messages. An online app store distributed Pebble-compatible apps from many developers including ESPN, Uber, Runkeeper, and GoPro.

document: Vine, a popular American short-form video hosting service, allowed users to share six-second-long looping video clips. Launched in 2013 by Vine Labs, Inc., it was acquired by Twitter, Inc. even before its official release. Sadly, Vine was shut down in 2017, with the discontinuation of its app a few months later. The service provided the option to share videos on various social networking platforms like Facebook and Twitter. Users could also explore themed groups of videos, hoping to see their own creations "trend."
noref_document: Vine was a short-form video hosting service that allowed users to share and watch six-second looping video clips. It quickly gained popularity as a platform for creative expression, with users showcasing their talents, humor, and storytelling abilities in compact and captivating videos. Vine provided a space for aspiring content creators to build a following and collaborate with others, and it paved the way for the rise of internet personalities and influencers. The app was known for its vibrant and diverse community, where users could discover and engage with a wide range of content, from comedy skits and music performances to DIY tutorials and mesmerizing visual effects. Although Vine was discontinued in 2017, its impact on internet culture and the way we consume and create content continues to resonate.
summary: Vine was an American short-form video hosting service where users could share six-second-long looping video clips. It was originally launched on January 24, 2013, by Vine Labs, Inc. Bought by Twitter, Inc. in 2012 before its launch, the service was shut down on January 17, 2017, and the app was discontinued a few months later.Videos published on Vine's social network could also be shared on different social networking platforms such as Facebook and Twitter. The Vine app was also used to browse videos, along with a group of videos that were uploaded by theme, and hoping that users could "trend" videos.

document: Rdio, a once popular online music streaming service, provided users with the ability to stream music for free with ads, or subscribe for an ad-free experience. With availability in 85 countries, it offered various platforms such as Android, iOS, Windows Phone, and even systems like Roku and Sonos. Users could stream music directly from Rdio's servers or download content for offline playback. Additionally, Rdio had a desktop client application for both OS X and Windows, along with a Windows Store application. Its impressive library included content from major record labels, as well as the Merlin Network and several aggregators. Moreover, Rdio incorporated social networking features, allowing users to share their favorite songs, albums, and playlists on Rdio and other platforms like Facebook and Twitter. Although Rdio faced financial troubles and filed for bankruptcy in 2015, it managed to sell certain intellectual property to Pandora Radio.
noref_document: Rdio is a music streaming service that was founded in 2008 and gained popularity for its vast library of songs and user-friendly interface. It allowed users to discover and listen to a wide range of music from various genres, making it a beloved platform for music enthusiasts. Rdio also incorporated social features, allowing users to follow their friends and listen to their playlists, fostering a sense of community within the platform. Despite its early success, Rdio eventually faced financial challenges and filed for bankruptcy in 2015. However, its legacy lives on, as it paved the way for the development of other popular music streaming services like Spotify and Apple Music.
summary:
Rdio (pronounced  "r-dee-oh") was an online music streaming service that offered ad-supported free streaming and ad-free subscription streaming services in 85 countries. It was available as a website and via app for Android, BlackBerry, iOS, and Windows Phone mobile devices, which could stream music from Rdio's servers or download music for offline playback; there were also clients for the Roku and Sonos systems. The web-based service also offered a native desktop client application for OS X and Windows, as well as a Windows Store application.Rdio's library had content from the four major record labels, as well as the Merlin Network and the aggregators BFM Digital, Catapult, CD Baby, boomertunes, INgrooves, and The Orchard. Rdio also offered social networking features, such as the ability to share songs, albums, and playlists with others on Rdio and social networks such as Facebook and Twitter.
On November 16, 2015, Rdio filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in which they had to pay $200 million and announced the sale of certain intellectual property to Pandora Radio.

document: Yik Yak, a pseudonymous social media smartphone application, initially launched in 2013 and relaunched in 2021. The app allows college students to engage in discussions within a 5-mile radius, termed "Yaks." While it shares similarities with other anonymous sharing apps, Yik Yak distinguishes itself by focusing on sharing primarily with those nearby. Despite experiencing significant growth in its early years, the app faced heavy criticism for promoting racism, antisemitism, sexism, and cyberbullying. Consequently, user downloads plummeted in 2016, leading Yik Yak to announce its closure in April 2017.
noref_document: Yik Yak is a location-based social media platform that gained popularity among college students when it was first launched in 2013. It allowed users to anonymously create and view "Yaks," short posts that could be upvoted or downvoted by others. This created a sense of community and real-time engagement, as users could see what was happening and being discussed around them. However, the app faced significant challenges due to issues with cyberbullying and harassment, leading to its eventual shutdown in 2017. Despite its controversies, Yik Yak served as a testament to the power of anonymous online communication and its impact on collective conversations.
summary: Yik Yak is a pseudonymous social media smartphone application that initially launched in 2013 and relaunched in 2021. The app, which is available for iOS and (formerly) Android, allows college students to create and view discussion threads within a 5-mile (8.0 km) radius (termed "Yaks" by the application). It is similar to other anonymous sharing apps such as Nearby, but differs from others such as Whisper in that it is intended for sharing primarily with those in proximity to the user.Despite strong levels of growth in 2013 and 2014, following several bouts of heavy criticism in the media over the dissemination of racism, antisemitism, sexism and the facilitation of cyber-bullying, the service saw stagnation in the growth of its user base. In 2016 alone, user downloads fell 76% compared to 2015. Failing to maintain user engagement, Yik Yak announced on April 28, 2017, that the service would close in the coming week.

document: Theranos Inc. was a once-promising health technology company founded in 2003 by Elizabeth Holmes. The company gained significant attention and raised over $700 million in funding, reaching a valuation of $10 billion. Theranos claimed to have developed breakthrough blood tests that required minimal blood samples and promised rapid and accurate results using their compact automated devices. However, these claims were later found to be false, leading to intense scrutiny and criticism. In 2015, doubts about Theranos's technology were raised by medical research professor John Ioannidis, clinical biochemistry professor Eleftherios Diamandis, and investigative journalist John Carreyrou of The Wall Street Journal. This revelation marked a turning point for the company.
noref_document: Theranos was a medical technology company founded in 2003 by Elizabeth Holmes. The company aimed to revolutionize the healthcare industry by offering a blood-testing device that required only a few drops of blood, promising faster results at a lower cost. However, concerns about the device's accuracy and reliability were raised, leading to an investigation by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Ultimately, in 2018, Theranos and Holmes settled with the SEC, and the company's operations were dissolved. The rise and fall of Theranos serve as a cautionary tale highlighting the importance of transparency and thorough validation in the development of groundbreaking technologies.
summary: Theranos Inc. () was an American privately held corporation that was touted as a breakthrough health technology company. Founded in 2003 by then 19-year-old Elizabeth Holmes, Theranos raised more than US$700 million from venture capitalists and private investors, resulting in a $10 billion valuation at its peak in 2013 and 2014. The company claimed that it had devised blood tests that required very small amounts of blood and that could be performed rapidly and accurately, all using compact automated devices which the company had developed. These claims were later proven to be false.A turning point came in 2015, when medical research professor John Ioannidis, and later professor of clinical biochemistry Eleftherios Diamandis, along with investigative journalist John Carreyrou of The Wall Street Journal, questioned the validity of Theranos's technology.

document: Juicero, an American company known for its innovative and tech-savvy approach to juicing, offered consumers a convenient way to enjoy freshly pressed fruit and vegetable juices. The star of their product lineup was the Juicero Press, a high-end pouring device equipped with Wi-Fi connectivity. What set Juicero apart was its proprietary single-serving packets of pre-chopped fruits and vegetables, which were exclusively sold through the company's subscription service. This unique system garnered significant attention from investors, securing the firm an impressive $120 million in venture capital. However, as the company faced slow sales, negative media coverage emerged when it was discovered that the expensive juicer was not necessary at all - the juice packets could be easily squeezed by hand. Ultimately, Juicero ceased operations in 2017 and began looking for a buyer for both the company and its valuable intellectual property.
noref_document: Juicero is a now-defunct company that was founded in 2013 and operated until 2017, with a focus on delivering fresh, cold-pressed juice to consumers in a convenient and innovative way. The company gained attention due to its proprietary juice press system, which utilized Wi-Fi connectivity and custom-designed packs of pre-cut fruits and vegetables. Customers could simply insert these packs into the press, and the machine would do the rest, producing a fresh glass of juice in seconds. Despite its initial success and investment from notable figures, Juicero faced controversy and criticism over the high price of both the machine and the juice packs, as some argued that the juice could be extracted by hand without the need for the expensive technology. Ultimately, these factors contributed to the downfall of Juicero, marking a cautionary tale in the world of food technology startups.
summary:
Juicero was an American company that designed, manufactured and sold the Juicero Press, a fruit and vegetable pouring device. The Juicero Press featured Wi-Fi connectivity and used proprietary, single-serving packets of pre-chopped fruits and vegetables that were sold exclusively by the company by subscription. From 2014 to 2017, the San Francisco-based firm received $120 million in startup venture capital from investors.The company attracted significant negative media attention when consumers and journalists discovered that its juice packets could be squeezed just as easily by hand as by the company's expensive juicer. In 2017, following slow sales, the company ceased operations and announced it was seeking a buyer for the company and its intellectual property.


== History ==
Juicero was founded in 2013 by Doug Evans, who served as CEO until October 2016, when former president of Coca-Cola North America Jeff Dunn took over the position.

document: Aereo, a technology company based in New York City, revolutionized the way people accessed and consumed television content. Through their innovative platform, subscribers were able to watch live and time-shifted streams of over-the-air television on their Internet-connected devices. Launched in March 2012 with the backing of Barry Diller's IAC, Aereo quickly gained popularity among users seeking a more flexible and personalized viewing experience. However, their journey was met with a significant setback when on June 25, 2014, the Supreme Court ruled against them in a case presented by several broadcast networks. The court deemed that Aereo's business model violated copyright holders' rights, as it was viewed as a "public performance" without obtaining necessary permissions. This ruling, despite the technological distinctions, equated Aereo's services to those of traditional cable television providers, ultimately leading to their downfall.
noref_document: Aereo is a now-defunct American technology company that provided a subscription-based service for streaming live and time-shifted over-the-air television programs online. Founded in 2012, Aereo aimed to enable consumers to access broadcast television stations using individually assigned antennas housed in remote data centers. This innovative approach allowed users to watch and record live television on various internet-connected devices without requiring a cable or satellite TV subscription. However, due to legal challenges from broadcast networks, Aereo was eventually forced to suspend its operations in 2014, marking the end of its short-lived but groundbreaking venture.
summary: Aereo was a technology company based in New York City that allowed subscribers to view live and time-shifted streams of over-the-air television on Internet-connected devices. The service opened to customers in March 2012, and was backed by Barry Diller's IAC.On June 25, 2014, the Supreme Court ruled against Aereo in a case brought by several broadcast networks. The Court found that Aereo infringed upon the rights of copyright holders. The point of contention was whether Aereo's business model constituted a "public performance", which would legally require it to obtain permission from the copyright owners of any programs it transmits. The court ruled in a 6–3 decision that Aereo's business model was no different from that of a cable television provider, despite the differences in technology.

document: Quibi, the short-form streaming platform, made its mark in the entertainment industry by providing content specifically designed for mobile devices. Founded in Los Angeles as NewTV in 2018 by Jeffrey Katzenberg, and led by CEO Meg Whitman, the platform managed to secure an impressive $1.75 billion in funding. Despite a highly anticipated launch in April 2020, Quibi unfortunately struggled to meet its subscriber projections and ultimately shut down in December of the same year. However, in a deal worth less than $100 million, the platform's content library found a new home with Roku, Inc. in January 2021.
noref_document: Quibi, short for "quick bites," is a short-form streaming platform that catered to mobile users by offering bite-sized entertainment content. Launched in April 2020, Quibi positioned itself as an innovative platform, creating original shows and movies specifically designed to be consumed on smartphones. Shows on Quibi were divided into episodes no longer than 10 minutes, allowing viewers to easily watch content during short breaks or commutes. With a wide range of genres and high-profile creators and actors involved, Quibi aimed to provide users with a quick and convenient way to access premium content on-the-go. Despite its star-studded lineup and significant investment, Quibi struggled to attract a substantial user base and ultimately shut down in December 2020.
summary: Quibi ( KWIB-ee) was an American short-form streaming platform that generated content for viewing on mobile devices. It was founded in Los Angeles in August 2018 as NewTV by Jeffrey Katzenberg and was led by Meg Whitman, its CEO. The service raised $1.75 billion from investors.  It launched in April 2020, but shut down in December 2020 after falling short of its subscriber projections. In January 2021, Quibi's content library was sold to Roku, Inc. for less than $100 million.

document: Grooveshark, an innovative web-based music streaming service, allowed users to upload and stream digital audio files while organizing them in personalized playlists. With a comprehensive search engine, music streaming capabilities, and a sophisticated music recommendation system, Grooveshark provided a unique platform for music enthusiasts. Despite facing legal battles, including a major lawsuit from Universal Music Group, the company successfully defended its right to use pre-1972 recordings. However, Grooveshark was also sued by EMI Music Publishing, Sony Music Entertainment, and Warner Music Group for copyright violations. Consequently, Apple and Facebook removed Grooveshark's applications from their respective platforms due to concerns regarding copyright issues.
noref_document: Grooveshark is a now-defunct online music streaming platform that was launched in 2007. It allowed users to search and share music files, creating personalized playlists and discovering new songs based on their tastes. Grooveshark amassed a vast library of music from various genres and artists, providing a convenient and accessible way for users to listen to their favorite tracks. However, due to legal challenges and copyright infringement issues, Grooveshark was forced to shut down in 2015. Despite its controversial history, Grooveshark remains an important part of the evolution of online music streaming platforms.
summary: Grooveshark was a web-based music streaming service owned and operated by Escape Media Group in the United States. Users could upload digital audio files, which could then be streamed and organized in playlists. The Grooveshark website had a search engine, music streaming features, and a music recommendation system.The company won a major lawsuit filed by Universal Music Group concerning use of Universal's pre-1972 recordings. Grooveshark was also sued for copyright violations by EMI Music Publishing, Sony Music Entertainment, and Warner Music Group. Concerns about copyrights led Apple and Facebook to remove Grooveshark's applications from the iOS App Store and Facebook platform respectively.

document: The Ouya, a microconsole developed by Ouya Inc, made its debut in 2012 under the leadership of Julie Uhrman. Uhrman enlisted the help of designer Yves Béhar and VP of Product Management Muffi Ghadiali to bring the project to life. Through a successful Kickstarter campaign, the development of Ouya was funded with a remarkable $8.5 million, making it one of the most successful projects in the crowdfunding platform's history. In 2013, the console began shipping to Kickstarter backers in March and was released to the public in June. Featuring an application store tailored specifically for Ouya-compatible games and apps, the platform primarily offered a wide range of casual games to its users.
noref_document: Ouya is a microconsole released in 2013 that aimed to revolutionize the gaming industry. Developed by the company of the same name, Ouya gained attention for its open-source approach and affordability. It believed in democratizing game development by providing an accessible platform for independent developers to create and share their games. With a focus on indie games and an online marketplace, Ouya provided a unique gaming experience for users seeking fresh and innovative titles. However, Ouya struggled to compete with more established gaming consoles and faced challenges in attracting a wide audience. Despite its eventual discontinuation in 2015, Ouya's impact on the gaming industry cannot be denied, as it inspired a new wave of microconsoles and highlighted the importance of indie game development.
summary:
The Ouya ( OO-yə), stylized as OUYA, is an Android-based microconsole developed by Ouya Inc. Julie Uhrman founded the project in 2012, bringing in designer Yves Béhar to collaborate on its design and Muffi Ghadiali as VP of Product Management to put together the engineering team. Development was funded via Kickstarter, raising US$8.5 million, becoming one of the website's highest earning projects in its history.
Units started to ship to Kickstarter backers in March 2013 and were released to the general public in June 2013. It featured a store for applications and games designed specifically for the Ouya platform, the majority of which were casual games.

document: The Burj Khalifa, formerly known as the Burj Dubai, stands tall and proud in the vibrant city of Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Rising to a staggering height of 829.8 meters (2,722 feet), it commands attention as the world's tallest building. The Burj Khalifa's impressive architecture includes a 242.6-meter spire, bringing its roof height to 828 meters (2,717 feet), surpassing the previous record-holder, Taipei 101. The construction of this monumental structure began in 2004 and was completed in 2009, showcasing a seamless blend of reinforced concrete and structural steel sourced from the Palace of the Republic in East Berlin. Located in the captivating neighborhood of Downtown Dubai, the Burj Khalifa has become a symbol of modernity and innovation.
noref_document: The Burj Khalifa is a towering skyscraper located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. As the tallest building in the world, it stands at an impressive height of 828 meters (2,717 feet) with 163 floors. The construction of this architectural marvel began in 2004 and was completed in 2010, symbolizing the rapid growth and innovation of Dubai. Apart from its breathtaking height, the Burj Khalifa features a unique design inspired by Islamic architecture, with setbacks that create a spiraling effect, giving it an iconic appearance. Besides being a prominent landmark, the Burj Khalifa serves multiple purposes, including offering luxurious residential spaces, housing corporate offices, and hosting a wide variety of amenities. With its observation deck on the 148th floor, it provides visitors with unmatched panoramic views of the city and surrounding areas. The Burj Khalifa stands as a testament to human ingenuity and engineering prowess, capturing the imagination of millions worldwide.
summary: The Burj Khalifa (known as the Burj Dubai prior to its inauguration in 2010) is a skyscraper in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. It is the world's tallest building. With a total height of 829.8 m (2,722 ft, or just over half a mile) and a roof height (excluding antenna, but including a 242.6 m spire) of 828 m (2,717 ft), the Burj Khalifa has been the tallest structure and building in the world since its topping out in 2009, supplanting Taipei 101, the previous holder of that status.Construction of the Burj Khalifa began in 2004, with the exterior completed five years later in 2009. The primary structure is reinforced concrete and some of the structural steel for the building originated from the Palace of the Republic in East Berlin, the former East German parliament. The building was opened in 2010 as part of a new development called Downtown Dubai.

document: The Shard, also known as the Shard London Bridge, is a remarkable 72-storey skyscraper located in Southwark, London. Designed by the renowned Italian architect Renzo Piano, it is the tallest building in the United Kingdom and Western Europe, standing at an impressive height of 309.6 metres (1,016 feet). The Shard forms part of The Shard Quarter development and replaced the previous 24-storey office block known as Southwark Towers. Construction on this iconic structure commenced in March 2009, and it was officially inaugurated on 5 July 2012, following its topping out on 30 March 2012.
noref_document: The Shard is a renowned skyscraper located in London, England. Standing at a height of 1,016 feet, it is currently the tallest building in the United Kingdom. Designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, The Shard has become an iconic symbol of modern architecture in London's skyline. With its distinctive glass facade, the building offers panoramic views of the city, attracting both locals and tourists alike. The Shard houses a range of facilities including offices, restaurants, a hotel, and even a public viewing gallery on its 72nd floor, providing visitors with breathtaking vistas of the capital.
summary:
The Shard, also referred to as the Shard London Bridge and formerly London Bridge Tower, is a 72-storey skyscraper, designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, in Southwark, London, that forms part of The Shard Quarter development. Standing 309.6 metres (1,016 feet) high, The Shard is the tallest building in the United Kingdom, and the tallest building in Western Europe. It is also the second-tallest free-standing structure in the United Kingdom, after the concrete tower of the Emley Moor transmitting station. It replaced Southwark Towers, a 24-storey office block built on the site in 1975.
The Shard's construction began in March 2009; it was topped out on 30 March 2012 and inaugurated on 5 July 2012.

document: One World Trade Center, also known as One World Trade or One WTC, stands as a testament to resilience and architectural prowess. Designed by David Childs of Skidmore, Owings & Merrill, this magnificent structure is not only the tallest building in the United States, but it also holds the prestigious title of the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. With its soaring height, it ranks as the seventh-tallest building in the entire world. This iconic skyscraper bears the same name as the ill-fated North Tower of the original World Trade Center, which tragically fell victim to the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks. Now, rising tall on the 16-acre World Trade Center site, precisely where the original 6 World Trade Center once stood, One World Trade Center serves as a symbol of triumph and renewal for Lower Manhattan, residing within the bounds of West Street to the west, Vesey Street to the north, Fulton Street to the south, and Washington Street to the east.
noref_document: One World Trade Center, also known as the Freedom Tower, is a prominent architectural landmark located in Lower Manhattan, New York City. Standing at a height of 1,776 feet, it is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. Built as a tribute to the original World Trade Center complex that tragically fell during the 9/11 terrorist attacks, One World Trade Center serves as a symbol of resilience and renewal. The building features cutting-edge design and technology, including a sustainable and energy-efficient infrastructure. It offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city, with observation decks on the 100th, 101st, and 102nd floors. The tower is home to various commercial offices and businesses, as well as a museum dedicated to the memory of the events of September 11, 2001.
summary: One World Trade Center, also known as One World Trade, One WTC, and formerly called  the Freedom Tower during initial planning stages, is the main building of the rebuilt World Trade Center complex in Lower Manhattan, New York City.  Designed by David Childs of Skidmore, Owings & Merrill, One World Trade Center is the tallest building in the United States, the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere, and the seventh-tallest in the world. The supertall structure has the same name as the North Tower of the original World Trade Center, which was destroyed in the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. The new skyscraper stands on the northwest corner of the 16-acre (6.5 ha) World Trade Center site, on the site of the original 6 World Trade Center. It is bounded by West Street to the west, Vesey Street to the north, Fulton Street to the south, and Washington Street to the east.

document: The CCTV Headquarters, located in the Beijing Central Business District, is the impressive headquarters for China Central Television (CCTV). Designed by renowned architects Rem Koolhaas and Ole Scheeren of OMA, and with engineering design by Cecil Balmond at Arup, this 51-floor skyscraper has garnered high praise from architecture critics worldwide. Considered by some as the most significant architectural accomplishment of the century, it was even awarded the title of Best Tall Building Worldwide in 2013. Construction began in 2004, but setbacks, such as a fire in the adjacent Television Cultural Center, delayed its completion until May 2012. Despite the challenges, the building's fascinating façade was finished in January 2008, and it was officially inaugurated in June 2013.
noref_document: The CCTV Headquarters, also known as the Chinese Central Television Headquarters, is a unique architectural marvel located in Beijing, China. Designed by the renowned firm, OMA, and completed in 2012, this iconic building has become a symbol of modern architecture and technological innovation. Its groundbreaking design, often referred to as "The Twisted Doughnut" or "The Loop," showcases two leaning towers connected by a striking horizontal structure. The CCTV Headquarters not only serves as the headquarters for China Central Television, but it also houses various television studios, production facilities, and offices. Its distinctive form and sleek structural design have earned it numerous accolades and have made it a popular tourist attraction in Beijing.
summary:
The CCTV Headquarters serves as the headquarters for China Central Television (CCTV) formerly located at the old China Central Television Building some 15 km (9.3 mi) to the west. Feted by architecture critics as perhaps "the greatest work of architecture built in this century"  and awarded the 2013 Best Tall Building Worldwide from the Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat, the 51-floor skyscraper on East Third Ring Road, Guanghua Road in the Beijing Central Business District (CBD). Groundbreaking took place on 1 June 2004 and the building's façade was completed in January 2008. After the construction was delayed by a fire that engulfed the adjacent Television Cultural Center in February 2009, the headquarters was completed in May 2012 and was officially inaugurated in June 2013.
Rem Koolhaas and Ole Scheeren of OMA were the architects in charge for the building, while Cecil Balmond at Arup provided the complex engineering design.

document: The Petronas Towers, also known as the Petronas Twin Towers and colloquially the KLCC Twin Towers, are a pair of 88-storey supertall skyscrapers in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Standing at 451.9 meters (1,483 feet), these towers were officially designated as the tallest buildings in the world from 1998 to 2004. They are also the world's tallest twin skyscrapers and remain a major landmark of Kuala Lumpur. The Petronas Towers' structural system, a tube in tube design, was invented by architect Fazlur Rahman Khan.
noref_document: The Petronas Towers, also known as the Petronas Twin Towers, are iconic landmarks located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Standing at 451.9 meters (1,483 feet) tall, they held the title of the world's tallest buildings from 1998 to 2004. Designed by Argentine architect Cesar Pelli, the towers are connected by a double-decker Skybridge on the 41st and 42nd floors, providing breathtaking views of the city. The towers are primarily occupied by the Malaysian oil and gas company, Petronas, while also housing various offices, shopping outlets, and a concert hall. The unique architecture and impressive height of the Petronas Towers make them a major tourist attraction and a symbol of Kuala Lumpur's modern development.
summary:
The Petronas Towers (Malay: Menara Berkembar Petronas), also known as the Petronas Twin Towers and colloquially the KLCC Twin Towers, are a pair of 88-storey supertall skyscrapers in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, standing at 451.9 metres (1,483 feet). From 1998 to 2004, they were officially designated as the tallest buildings in the world until they were surpassed by the completion of the Taipei 101 in 2004.  The Petronas Towers are the world's tallest twin skyscrapers and remained the tallest buildings in Malaysia until 2019, when they were surpassed by The Exchange 106. The Petronas Towers are a major landmark of Kuala Lumpur, along with the nearby Kuala Lumpur Tower and Merdeka 118, and are visible in many places across the city.


== History and architecture ==
The Petronas Towers' structural system is a tube in tube design, invented by architect Fazlur Rahman Khan.

document: Marina Bay Sands (MBS), an integrated resort in Singapore, is a remarkable architectural feat designed by Moshe Safdie. This extravagant property, opened in 2010, boasts a 2,561-room hotel, a colossal convention-exhibition center, a high-end shopping mall called The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, a museum, renowned restaurants by celebrity chefs, two floating crystal pavilions, captivating art-science exhibits, and the world's largest atrium casino. The complex comprises three towers connected by a 340-meter-long SkyPark, offering breathtaking views and a 150-meter infinity swimming pool that extends over the north tower, providing a mesmerizing experience. Despite slight construction delays, primarily due to financial crises, Marina Bay Sands has become an emblem of luxury, entertainment, and architectural splendor in the heart of Singapore's Downtown Core district.
noref_document: Marina Bay Sands is a famous integrated resort located in Singapore. It is an architectural marvel, featuring three luxurious hotel towers, a vast convention center, a grand casino, a shopping mall, numerous dining options, and an iconic rooftop that offers breathtaking views of the city skyline. The resort is renowned for its unique design, which includes a boat-shaped SkyPark that spans across the top of the three towers, housing an observation deck, lush gardens, and an infinity pool. Marina Bay Sands has become a cultural landmark, hosting a plethora of world-class entertainment events, exhibitions, and concerts that attract visitors from all over the globe.
summary:
The Marina Bay Sands  (abbreviation: MBS) is an integrated resort fronting Marina Bay within the Downtown Core district of Singapore. At its opening in 2010, it was billed as the world's most expensive standalone casino property at S$8 billion (US$6.88 billion), including the land cost. It is owned by the Singaporean affiliate of the Las Vegas Sands Corporation.
Designed by Moshe Safdie, the resort includes a 2,561-room hotel, a 120,000-square-metre (1,300,000 sq ft) convention-exhibition centre, the 74,000-square-metre (800,000 sq ft) The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands mall, a museum, a large theatre, "celebrity chef" restaurants, two floating crystal pavilions, art-science exhibits, and the world's largest atrium casino with 500 tables and 1,600 slot machines. The complex includes three towers topped by a connecting 340-metre-long (1,120 ft) SkyPark with a capacity of 3,902 people and a 150 m (490 ft) infinity swimming pool, set on top of the world's largest public cantilevered platform, which overhangs the north tower by 66.5 m (218 ft).The building and its surrounds was originally set to open in 2009, but its construction faced slight delays caused by escalating costs of material and labour shortages, aggravated from the global financial crisis at the time.

document: Tokyo Skytree, a broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo, is an impressive architectural landmark that stands as the tallest structure in Japan. With a height of 634 meters (2,080 ft), it became the tallest tower in the world upon its completion in 2011. It is not only a significant broadcasting hub for the Kantō region but also an iconic symbol of Japan's technological prowess. Tokyo Skytree provides an alternative to the older Tokyo Tower, which faces coverage challenges due to its proximity to high-rise buildings. This majestic tower, completed on Leap Day in 2012, has since been welcoming visitors who can experience breathtaking views from its observation decks.
noref_document: The Tokyo Skytree is a prominent landmark and an architectural marvel located in Tokyo, Japan. Standing at a height of 634 meters (2,080 feet), it easily holds the title of the tallest tower in Japan and one of the tallest towers in the world. Designed with a distinctive futuristic aesthetic, the Tokyo Skytree acts as a broadcasting, observation, and communication tower. Its primary purpose is to provide digital television and radio broadcasting to the Kanto region, but it also serves as a popular tourist attraction. Visitors can take high-speed elevators up to the observation decks located at 350 meters (1,150 feet) and 450 meters (1,480 feet), offering breathtaking panoramic views of Tokyo and beyond. The Tokyo Skytree is not only an architectural marvel but also a symbol of the city's modernity and innovation.
summary:
Tokyo Skytree (東京スカイツリー, Tōkyō Sukaitsurī), [toːkʲoː sɯ̥kaitsɯriː] is a broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo. It became the tallest structure in Japan in 2010 and reached its full height of 634 meters (2,080 ft) in March 2011, making it the tallest tower in the world, displacing the Canton Tower, and the third tallest structure in the world after the Merdeka 118 (678.9 m or 2,227 ft) and the Burj Khalifa (829.8 m or 2,722 ft). It is also the tallest freestanding structure in the OECD, the G20 and G7 countries.
The tower is the primary television and radio broadcast site for the Kantō region; the older Tokyo Tower no longer gives complete digital terrestrial television broadcasting coverage because it is surrounded by high-rise buildings. Skytree was completed on Leap Day, 29 February 2012, with the tower opening to the public on 22 May 2012.

document: Metropol Parasol, also known as Setas de Sevilla or The Mushrooms, is an impressive wooden structure located in the old quarter of Seville, Spain. Designed by German architect Jürgen Mayer, it was completed in April 2011 and is approximately 150 by 70 meters in size with a height of 26 meters. The structure features six parasols that resemble large mushrooms and is constructed using 3,500 cubic meters of micro-laminated Finnish pine. It houses a traditional market, restaurants, an archaeological museum, a performance square, and a rooftop terrace offering panoramic views of Seville's old city. Despite initial technical and budgetary challenges, Metropol Parasol has become the city's third most-visited urban landmark since its opening.
noref_document: Metropol Parasol, also known as Las Setas (The Mushrooms), is an iconic structure located in the heart of Seville, Spain. Designed by architect Jürgen Mayer, this unique wooden structure stands as the largest wooden structure in the world. Spanning over four levels, Metropol Parasol boasts a stunning architectural design that transforms the traditional perception of a plaza. The structure's undulating shape offers shade from the scorching Spanish sun, while its uppermost level provides breathtaking panoramic views of Seville's cityscape. Additionally, the lower levels of the structure host a vibrant market, housing numerous bars, cafes, and shops, creating a bustling atmosphere for locals and tourists alike. Metropol Parasol's emergence has brought a modern twist to the historic city of Seville, becoming a symbol of contemporary architecture and a must-visit landmark for visitors.
summary:
Setas de Sevilla ("Mushrooms of Seville") or Las Setas ("The Mushrooms"), initially titled Metropol Parasol, is a large, predominantly wood structure located at La Encarnación square in the old quarter of Seville, Spain. It accommodates a traditional market, restaurants, a performance square, archaeological museum — and 'rooftop' terrace with a panoramic view of Seville's old city.
Selected from 65 submissions in a city-sponsored competition, the structure was designed by German architect Jürgen Mayer, was completed in April 2011, and is roughly 150 by 70 metres (490 by 230 ft) with an approximate height of 26 metres (85 ft).Initially beset with technical problems as well as budget and schedule overruns, the parasols are constructed of 3,500 cubic meters of micro-laminated Finnish pine and are marketed as the world's largest wood structure.Since their opening, the parasols have become Seville's third-most visited urban landmark.


== The name ==
During development, the project was titled Metropol Parasol, with locals quickly adopting a colloquial nickname, the setas or mushrooms. Seville officially adopted the name Setas de Sevilla after discovering the project's architect had trademarked the name "Metropol Parasol" and would charge for its use; Setas de Sevilla has been the project's official name since opening,


== Design ==
The structure consists of six parasols loosely resembling large mushrooms, inspired by the vaults of the Cathedral of Seville and the ficus trees in the nearby Plaza de Cristo de Burgos.

document: The Broad, a contemporary art museum located on Grand Avenue in Downtown Los Angeles, stands as a testament to the passion for art and philanthropy of its namesake, Eli and Edythe Broad. The museum showcases an impressive art collection housed within a remarkable $140 million building that was financed by the couple. Visitors can enjoy free general admission to explore the permanent collection galleries, providing an accessible way to immerse themselves in the world of contemporary art. While the museum offers various events and exhibits, it's worth noting that not all of these are free, and admission prices may vary. Since its opening on September 20, 2015, The Broad has become an artistic haven in the heart of Los Angeles.
noref_document: The Broad is a contemporary art museum located in downtown Los Angeles, California. Founded by philanthropists Eli and Edythe Broad, the museum opened its doors to the public in 2015 and houses a vast collection of contemporary art, including works by renowned artists such as Andy Warhol, Jeff Koons, and Cindy Sherman. summary: The Broad () is a contemporary art museum on Grand Avenue in Downtown Los Angeles. The museum is named for philanthropists Eli and Edythe Broad, who financed the $140 million building that houses the Broad art collections. It offers free general admission to its permanent collection galleries. However, not all of its events are free and admission prices may vary by exhibit and/or by event.
